meanings.definition: A false or misleading story or report.
meanings.sent1: The canular about aliens landing in the backyard spread quickly.
meanings.sent2: She knew the canular about winning the lottery was too good to be true.
meanings.sent3: The canular claiming that dogs can talk had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His elaborate canular about finding buried treasure fooled many.
meanings.sent5: The canular about a magical potion was the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone with a false story or report.
meanings.sent1: He tried to canular his friends with a made-up adventure story.
meanings.sent2: She canularled her brother into thinking he had won a prize.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to canular their teacher with a fake spider prank.
meanings.sent4: The con artist canularled many people into investing in his fake company.
meanings.sent5: The magician canularled the audience with his disappearing act.
